alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 08 at 2:27PM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Large waves and dangerous surf conditions. Breakers 29 to 33 feet. * WHERE...North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast. * WHEN...From 4 AM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Destructive waves may wash over beaches, jetties, and other structures unexpectedly. People can be swept off rocks and jetties and drown while observing high surf. Severe beach erosion may destroy coastal properties and buildings. Higher than normal water run-up is expected on beaches and low- lying shoreline.
info.instruction: A High Surf Warning means that high surf will affect beaches, producing rip currents, sneaker waves and beach erosion. Stay well back from the water`s edge and be alert for exceptionally high waves. Keep away from large logs on the beach. Water running up on the beach can lift or roll logs which can injure or kill someone caught in their path.

area.areaDesc: Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast
